fullProgramDescription: The Astronomy and Astrophysics major is designed to provide a broad and deep understanding of the field, including the underlying physics and mathematics that govern the behavior of celestial objects and the universe as a whole. Students in this major will gain a strong foundation in astronomy, physics, and mathematics, as well as computational skills and data analysis techniques.
shortProgramDescription: The Astronomy & Astrophysics B.A. program provides a comprehensive education in the field, preparing students for careers or further study in astronomy, physics, or related fields.
classHighlights: The Astronomy and Astrophysics major requires a series of core courses in physics, mathematics, and astronomy, including Mechanics (PHYSICS2A or2B), Electricity and Magnetism (PHYSICS2B or2D), and Introduction to Astrophysics (ASTR20).
Students also complete a set of upper-division courses in astronomy and physics, including Stellar Astrophysics (ASTR120), Galaxies and Cosmology (ASTR130), and Observational Astronomy (ASTR140).
Mathematics courses include Calculus (MATH10A-B-C or20A-B-C) and Differential Equations (MATH20D or21D), as well as Linear Algebra (MATH18 or31A) and Mathematical Methods for Physics (PHYSICS110A-B).
Additional required courses include Computational Physics (PHYSICS105 or141) and Statistical Mechanics and Thermodynamics (PHYSICS112).

Students also complete a laboratory course, Observational Astronomy Laboratory (ASTR140L), and a senior-level seminar or capstone course is not required, however a writing course is required (ASTR190W is an option).
learningOutcomes: Understand the fundamental principles of astronomy and astrophysics, including the behavior of celestial objects and the universe.
Apply mathematical and computational skills to analyze and interpret astronomical data.
Demonstrate a strong foundation in physics, including mechanics, electromagnetism, and thermodynamics.
Communicate complex scientific concepts effectively in written and oral forms.
Analyze and interpret astronomical data, including observations and simulations.
additionalInformation: The Astronomy and Astrophysics major is a challenging and rewarding program that prepares students for a wide range of careers in science, technology, and education. Students are encouraged to participate in research projects, internships, and other extracurricular activities to enhance their education and career prospects.
